stimulusHtml: A distribution of scores is approximately normal with a mean of 78 and a standard deviation of 8.6. Which of the following equations can be used to find the score x above which 33 percent of the scores fall?
choicesHtml: 0.44 = x − 78 ( 8.6 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44DC@

0.67 = x − 78 ( 8.6 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44E1@

0.33 = x − 78 8.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4298@

0.44 = x − 78 8.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@429A@

0.67 = x − 78 8.6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@429F@
